column9: This is the second time I have used this product and what a relief it brought to me. I have been able to sleep and have not had the horriable constant pain associated with the UTI. column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: This medication is a miracle pill for those with UTI's. I've had the unfortunate luck of having way too many to count UTI's since I was in Kindergarten. When I was little I didn't have these pills or if they did they never prescribed them.  I'm so happy to have them because they make having a UTI a little easier to live with.

column2: Molly Frances, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: For several yrs now I have been plagued w UTI's. I've taken so many antibiotics I've had to use such a 'cure' the equivalent of about 4 to 7 mths of each of those yrs. Finally this last June, I decided no more antibiotics! I had a generous prescription of phenazopyridine  from an understanding dr and zealously began a 'new' regimen. I try to eat a v good diet w lots of true yogurt. I try to bathroom when needed and do a good job of it --emptying the bladder throughly.  Incontinence has made pads a reality of my life but whenever possible I do without pads. I mostly wear white, loose undergarments. Dresses too. I use hypoallergenic baby wipes before bathrooming and as a hygienic wipe afterwards. I drink water hour on and hour off. I carry it w me driving, going out etc. I use cranberry pills --in a sense, therapeutically. Of great importance at the 1st sign of symptoms of an UTI I Use phenazopyridine for 2-3 days (at most). I may --but try not to-- use some creams (medicated) for comfort at night. I regularly use Replens nearly every day. It is now four mths since I finished my last course of antibiotics! Now that this med is no longer available from the pharmacy how do I get it? What is its plain-jane name?

column2: LDK, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I am a registered nurse and just wanted to let everyone know this can be purchased over-the-counter (around 5 bucks).  The only difference between OTC and prescription is the stregnth; 95mg versus 200mg.  Most people can treat the symptoms with this medication and within 48 hours the infection is gone without use of an antibiotic. Lots of fluids meaning water and cranberry juice in the 48 hour window will usually do the trick.  If you still have symptoms after 48 hours, you will need and antibiotic.  THE KEY IS LOTS OF FLUIDS!!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: You MUST take an antibiotic WITH this medicine in order to get rid of the infection.  This is just a very effective pain reliever used to treat the symptons of pain, burningn and spasms you get when you have a bladder or Urinary tract infection.  This medicine does NOT the infection.  You must get an antiobiotic from the doctor for that.  But this medicine will get you out of pain until you can get there, hopefully the same day!

column9: It totally stopped the kicking kidney ache and the urge to urinate and feel finished when finally going. Another time I needed the antibiotics as I had a full blown Urinary Tract Infection and therefore just the pain easing of this drug was not enough and I needed my doctor to put me on treatment for UTI.  There seem to be over the counter versions of this in the drug store but I've never tried and it's the kind of pain you want to get treated right away.
